name: Shattered
description: The unexpected trip to the 20th and 21st century may not be the accident it was first assumed to be. But if the displacement was deliberate, who was behind it? And why? What will be the future impacts of this shard of time?
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Klingon, Section 31, and Terran Empire Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using 2024 Picard, any version of Taylor, T'Pol, Braxton, or Displaced crew will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Taylor, T'Pol, Braxton, 2024 Picard, or Displaced
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Paris
featured_crew.flavor: An aficionado of all things 20th century, Tom Paris still struggled to fit in amid people on Earth in 1997.

action.name: Is It So Unusual To Care About Something More?

featured_crew.name: T'Pol
featured_crew.flavor: Along with Archer, T'Pol goes back to 21st century Detroit to stop the Xindi-Reptilians.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: Skill

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

action.name: Is It So Unusual To Care About Something More?

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

adventures.name: Rules of Acquisition
adventures.description: Gather basic minerals for the anomaly and for travel.

adventures.name: Distant Origin
adventures.description: Locate antimatter to assist in the reaction for the anomaly.

adventures.name: Reunion
adventures.description: Gather everyone brought back from the 24th century.

adventures.name: The Voyage Home
adventures.description: Generate an anomaly bound for the 24th century.

rewards.name: Shattered
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

adventures.name: Reunion
adventures.description: Gather everyone brought back from the 24th century.

adventures.name: The War Without
adventures.description: Ensure all intent on altering the present are apprehended.

adventures.name: The Bonding
adventures.description: Crystalize enough dilithium to get everyone home.

adventures.name: The Voyage Home
adventures.description: Generate an anomaly bound for the 24th century.

rewards.name: Shattered
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

goals.flavor: Curb impacts on the future with the Klingon Empire.
Temper changes to the timeline with the Terran Empire.

rewards.name: T'Pol
rewards.flavor: Along with Archer, T'Pol goes back to 21st century Detroit to stop the Xindi-Reptilians.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "Captain, it would seem our original suspicions about what brought us back to this point in history may not have been entirely correct. There is reason to believe the anomalies that sent us back were generated intentionally, rather than by accident."

"I believe you may be right, Sub-Commander. There are many differences between the makeup of these anomalies and the ones we've seen in our own time. Unfortunately, we have yet to pinpoint a perpetrator."

"Come now, Picard. Don't tell me you no idea. I would think your eyes would be open wide by now. You may still be sold on that sap about the Federation being a beacon of hope, but surely you recognize it has its share of...haters, to borrow a term from this century."

"Just as the birth of the Federation was more than that pivotal first contact, so too are the forces that threaten to snuff it out more than they seem. If you hope to find them, Captain, you'll need to learn to see the forest for the trees...to borrow another saying from this era."

"Captain, it would seem our original suspicions about what brought us back to this point in history may not have been entirely correct. There is reason to believe the anomalies that sent us back were generated intentionally, rather than by accident."

"I believe you may be right, Sub-Commander. There are many differences between the makeup of these anomalies and the ones we've seen in our own time. Unfortunately, we have yet to pinpoint a perpetrator."

"Come now, Picard. Don't tell me you no idea. I would think your eyes would be open wide by now. You may still be sold on that sap about the Federation being a beacon of hope, but surely you recognize it has its share of...haters, to borrow a term from this century."

"Just as the birth of the Federation was more than that pivotal first contact, so too are the forces that threaten to snuff it out more than they seem. If you hope to find them, Captain, you'll need to learn to see the forest for the trees...to borrow another saying from this era."
"What've you got to say now, Q? It would seem we've managed to suss out those who brought us here. Though to think it would be the Romulans and the Borg working with several others..."
"Yet, our perpetrators are but a small contingent. It would seem our omnipotent interloper has overestimated those working against us...or perhaps underestimated our own abilities."

responses.text: "They have no choice but to assist us."
"Good point. The Borg have more room."

screens.text: "Is that an attempt at trash talk? Or a motivational speech? With you Vulcans, it's so hard to tell. Either way, your overconfidence is amusing. What are you going to do about the ones you've caught? How are you getting home? Don't tell me you expect a ride from the Romulans?"
"Ah yes, force it out of them. You're really a shining example of the Federation's ideals, aren't you, Captain?"
"Such optimism and yet you cannot solve the temporal anomaly crisis from your own time."
"I doubt your sense of humor will land well with the old hive mind. But at least it'll be a quiet ride assuming you aren't plugged in to the Collective."
"It's about time you all head back to your own time, don't you think, Captain? These tabloids are gaining a little too much credibility off all these actual alien sightings."
"What've you got to say now, Q? It would seem we've managed to suss out those who brought us here. Though to think it would be the Romulans and the Borg working with several others..."
"Yet, our perpetrators are but a small contingent. It would seem our omnipotent interloper has overestimated those working against us...or perhaps underestimated our own abilities."

responses.text: "They have no choice but to assist us."
"Good point. The Borg have more room."

"Ah yes, force it out of them. You're really a shining example of the Federation's ideals, aren't you, Captain?"
"Such optimism and yet you cannot solve the temporal anomaly crisis from your own time."
"I doubt your sense of humor will land well with the old hive mind. But at least it'll be a quiet ride assuming you aren't plugged in to the Collective."
"It's about time you all head back to your own time, don't you think, Captain? These tabloids are gaining a little too much credibility off all these actual alien sightings."
